data.Sentence_cn: 课文14  蝴蝶效应
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 14 The Butterfly Effect

data.Sentence_cn: 为什么小的误差就不能准确地预测天气系统?
data.Sentence: Why do small errors make it impossible to predict the weather system with a high degree of accuracy?

data.Sentence_cn: 世界上最好的两三天以上的天气预报具有很强的猜测性，
data.Sentence: Beyond two or three days, the world's best weather forecasts are speculative,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果超过六七天，天气预报就没有了任何价值。
data.Sentence: and beyond six or seven they are worthless.

data.Sentence_cn: 原因是蝴蝶效应。
data.Sentence: The Butterfly Effect is the reason.

data.Sentence_cn: 对于小片的恶劣天气，
data.Sentence: For small pieces of weather--

data.Sentence_cn: 对一个全球性的气象预报员来说，“小”可以意味着雷暴雨和暴风雪。
data.Sentence: and to a global forecaster, small can mean thunderstorms and blizzards--

data.Sentence_cn: 任何预测的质量会很快下降。
data.Sentence: any prediction deteriorates rapidly.

data.Sentence_cn: 错误和不可靠性上升，接踵而来的是一系列湍流的徵状，
data.Sentence: Errors and uncertainties multiply, cascading upward through a chain of turbulent features,

data.Sentence_cn: 从小尘暴和暴风发展到只有卫星上可以看到的席卷整块大陆的旋涡。
data.Sentence: from dust devils and squalls up to continent-size eddies that only satellites can see.

data.Sentence_cn: 现代气象模型以一个坐标图来显示，图中每个点大约是间隔60英里。
data.Sentence: The modern weather models work with a grid of points of the order of sixty miles apart,

data.Sentence_cn: 既使是这样，有些开始时的资料也不得不依靠推测，
data.Sentence: and even so, some starting data has to be guessed,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为地面工作站和卫星不可能看到地球上的每一个地方。
data.Sentence: since ground stations and satellites cannot see everywhere.

data.Sentence_cn: 假设地球上可以布满传感器，
data.Sentence: But suppose the earth could be covered with sensors spaced one foot apart,

data.Sentence_cn: 每个相隔1英尺，并按1英尺的间隔从地面一直排列到大气层的顶端。
data.Sentence: rising at one-foot intervals all the way to the top of the atmosphere.

data.Sentence_cn: 再假定每个传感器都极极端准确地读出了温度、
data.Sentence: Suppose every sensor gives perfectly accurate readings of temperature,

data.Sentence_cn: 气压、温度和气象学家需要的任何其他数据。
data.Sentence: pressure, humidity, and any other quantity a meteorologist would want.

data.Sentence_cn: 在正午时分，一个功能巨大的计算机搜集了所有的资料，并算出在每一个点
data.Sentence: Precisely at noon an infinitely powerful computer takes all the data and calculates what will happen at each point

data.Sentence_cn: 计算机无法推断出1个月以后的某一天，新泽西州的普林斯顿究竟是晴天还是雨天。
data.Sentence: The computer will still be unable to predict whether Princeton, New Jersey, will have sun or rain on a day one month away.

data.Sentence_cn: 正午时分，传感器之间的距离会掩盖计算机无法知道的波动，
data.Sentence: At noon the spaces between the sensors will hide fluctuations that the computer will not know about,

data.Sentence_cn: 任何偏平均值的变化。
data.Sentence: tiny deviations from the average.

data.Sentence_cn: 到12：01时，那些波动就已经会在1英尺远的地方造成偏差。
data.Sentence: By 12.01, those fluctuations will already have created small errors one foot away.

data.Sentence_cn: 很快这种偏差会增加到尺10英的范围，如此等等，一直到全球的范围。
data.Sentence: Soon the errors will have multiplied to the ten-foot scale, and so on up to the size of the globe.
